title: Helps me with my depression
author: StarBitsUniverse
review: This game is so upbeat and has so much passion poured into it. The characters, the humor and even the buildings have so much character and individuality compared to other games of this genre. What I mean is I'll compare a game in HappyStreet's genre to a separate game. This game is Farm Story. In Farm story after you've planted your crops you have to wait. However in HappyStreet things move much faster. So the game keeps a player playing for hours on end. A problem with most games in it's genre is that once you've planted your seed or built your buildings you have to wait. However in HappyStreet you can help your villagers and earn coins. These quest are very simple and don't actually show up in the quest box but it's a great way to be entertained if you waiting for a meeting or just wanna sit down and play. The list of the kinds of these minor quest go on and on. Overall absolutely recommend this game to anyone.

I emailed customer service, and they rolled my data back to an even older save (which didn't make any sense), so I lost even more buildings... two entire neighborhoods worth I worked hard to get. On top of that, now customer service won't respond to email and ignores me. I sadly decided to quit and just delete the game, which is a shame too, since I payed actual money a few times for in game purchases, and lost out a bit. I will stick with Sims FreePlay and Pet Buddies, where the customer service is stellar when you have a game issue, and the data saves are more reliable. Happy Street's customer service could care less. They lost out on future money from me.

title: Great game, love it
author: TriniNutshack
review: A few months back I was in need of a city/town building game, one with animals or cartoony characters because that's just my sort of thing. I went through a lot of games like that and I dropped all of them after a day or two because they just felt bland or had a major paywall. I looked over happy street several times expecting it to be just like the rest but when I finally tried it, boy was I wrong :). It's a very polished game with no crashes or issues (at least for me), the game has a cast of likable   characters with their own distinct personalities that I was not expecting from a free game. It's also very fun to see the way in which the main cast interact with one another and the jokes and gags that's are bound to happen when they do during or at the end of quest. You could easily play the entire game free of charge as none of the quest require cash to complete and on top of that if you're a person who doesn't like to spend money on app games and you see buildings you want but have to pay for don't worry you could easily stock up on floor by watching advertisement and get those buildings in a few days or less depending on how often you watch those ads the longest ad being 30 seconds long and some ads just being a picture that you can exit out of and get free floor.

title: Happy Street is the BEST!

review:
I remember having this game a few years ago, after my friend told me about it. I was intrigued after hearing there was a bird that pooped on villagers. After my iPod got reset, I gave up on it. 
However, recently I've downloaded this game again, and all I can say is I'm in love with it again. I grow levels very quickly considering it takes a lot xp. points to level where I'm at! You'd imagine it'd take forever considering the only way to gain experience is to restock your stores, and with level three stores this takes longer. Anyways- enough ranting on levels. This game is beautifully designed. The colors are appealing, the humor with Zoë and Billy (and even Pepin and Nyok sometimes) is great, it's very easy to get currency in the game (I'm looking at you, TeamLava), and all in all its just great. After this update, my game doesn't crash anymore. My little brother gets a big laugh out of the dinosaurs that pass his village 😂.  

Now STOP reading these reviews and download this amazing game! 

(Also Zoë X Billy is one of my OTPs I swear😂 No matter what anyone says)
